lead_paragraph: MENDELOW--Steven, 73, of Manhattan. Devoted son, husband, father, brother and grandfather. Beloved son of the late Robert and Henrietta, survived by his wife and loving partner of 45 years Nancy, devoted daughters Cara and Pam, dear sister Peggy, and adored grandchildren Michael, Alexander, and Jessica. Steve was raised in Brooklyn and Oceanside, NY, graduated from Bucknell University, served in the US Army from 1966-68, and for nearly 50 years served as accountant and financial adviser to countless individuals, families, and businesses. Among his passions were reading, current events, world travel, mentoring young entrepreneurs, and his family. He is remembered by those who love him as a loyal friend, talented athlete, fierce competitor and creative problem-solver who valued hard work, generosity, and family. Tireless supporter of many organizations in the fields of medical research, international relations, and children's services. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the EnCourage Kids Foundation and Foundation Fighting Blindness. Funeral services at "The Riverside," 76th and Amsterdam Ave., on Wednesday, June 8th at 11:15am followed by burial at Mt. Moriah Cemetery. 1/3
